intro: Sphaerostephanos indrapurae, commonly known as the Indrapura star-fruit, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs known for their aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
